_header: Alas alas how [?who] is it hath given entrance
_description:
Despair in Love, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 110) — three 9-line stanzas and 5-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
Allas allas how is hit heth gen entresseVnto myn hert this woful
                    tidyngis here…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Thus is he greid woo doth him so aboundAnd saith how that
                    his lijf doth him ennoy
